description.value:
Trigger Both secret doors are closed and at least one creature is in the room

Effect Gas fills the chamber. Creatures within the chamber must succeed on a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Stupefied]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Stupefied]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure). The trap then rolls initiative.

stealth.details: +21 (expert) or @Check[type:perception|dc:31|traits:action:seek] (expert) to notice the hidden override mechanism in the north wall

details.description: Seven nozzles hidden within holes in the 15â€‘foot-high ceiling release a poison gas.
details.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:33|name:Disable Hidden Mechanism|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable the hidden mechanism on the north wall, immediately sucking the gas from the room, or @Check[type:thievery|dc:29|name:Plug One Nozzle|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to adequately plug one of the seven nozzles. When all seven nozzles are plugged or destroyed, the trap is deactivated.
details.reset: After an hour, the trap deactivates; the gas disperses slowly, and the doors can be opened again. After 24 hours, the gas builds up and the trap can be triggered again.
details.routine:
(1 action) The gas intensifies. Each creature in the room must make a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30].

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune to the gas for 1 hour, though if the creature has already been stupefied by the trap, that condition remains for its normal duration.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Stupefied]{Stupefied 1} for 24 hours. If the target is already stupefied, the condition value increases by 1 (to a maximum of stupefied 4) and the target takes [[/r 8d6[mental]]] damage.

Critical Effect As failure, except the target takes double the mental damage.
